author: Alexandra Rucki
title: Warning after man tries to abduct boy walking home from school
text:
News Warning after man tries to abduct boy walking home from school The 15-year-old was walking home from school along Marsland Road, in Sale, when he was approached by a man in a small blue car Share The boy was approached on Marsland Road, in Sale   school has issued a warning to parents after a man tried to abduct a 15-year-old schoolboy. 
The boy was walking home from school along Marsland Road, in Sale , when he was approached by a man in a small blue car. 
The man, aged in his 30s, is said to have told the schoolboy he was delivering a parcel to his mother. 
He then asked the boy if he would also like a lift. 
The teenager refused the lift and the car drove off from the scene. 
His parents reported the incident to police following the incident on Wednesday (February 22). 
The man is described as white, of slim build and has grey or brown hair with a short beard. 
His hairstyle is shaved at the sides and long on top. Read More 
Police said the boy was not hurt. 
No registration plate for the car has been revealed. 
Ashton-on-Mersey High School sent an email alert urging parents to be vigilant the morning after the incident. 
The warning said: “We are again reminding pupils of the importance of taking care when travelling to and from school and wherever possible walking in pairs or small groups on well used routes. 
“Please can you again reinforce this message at home and ensure all our pupils remain vigilant.” 
Greater Manchester Police have launched an investigation and are appealing for anyone with further information to come forward. 
A spokesman said: “We were called to reports of a 15-year-old boy approached by a man claiming to know his mother. 
“He said he had a package. The man was described as white aged in his 30s and of slim build. 
“He had light brown or grey hair, shaved at the sides and long on top, with a beard.” Read More 
Parents of children at Ashton-on-Mersey School were sent a similar warning in November last year after a woman attempted to abduct an 11-year-old boy. 
The incident took place on 
Shrewsbury Road in the Brooklands area of Sale. 
A woman driving a black VW Golf wound down her window and told the boy she would give him a lift home. 
Anyone with information can call police on 101 or Crimestoppers, anonymously, on 0800 555 11, quoting log number 1099/24/2. Like us on Facebook
